Samvidhan: Constitution Timeline

Explore the fascinating journey of how India's Constitution came into existence through this interactive timeline

1858-1947
British Rule & Early Demands

The seeds of constitutional development were sown during British rule with acts like the Government of India Act 1858, Indian Councils Act 1909, Government of India Act 1919 and 1935.

Key milestones:

  • 1885: Formation of Indian National Congress
  • 1928: Nehru Report demanding Dominion Status
  • 1934: M.N. Roy first proposed Constituent Assembly
Dec 9, 1946
First Meeting of Constituent Assembly

The Constituent Assembly met for the first time in the Constitution Hall (now Parliament's Central Hall).

Key facts:

  • Total members: 389 (reduced to 299 after Partition)
  • Sachchidananda Sinha was the first temporary chairman
  • Dr. Rajendra Prasad was elected permanent Chairman
  • Objective Resolution moved by Jawaharlal Nehru on Dec 13, 1946
1947-1949
Drafting the Constitution

The actual drafting work was done by the Drafting Committee chaired by Dr. B.R. Ambedkar.

Key aspects:

  • Drafting Committee formed on Aug 29, 1947
  • Took 2 years, 11 months and 18 days to complete
  • Total expenditure: ₹6.4 million
  • Influences came from multiple countries' constitutions
Nov 26, 1949
Constitution Adopted

The Constitution was adopted on this day (celebrated as Constitution Day since 2015).

Interesting facts:

  • 284 members signed the document
  • Original copies were handwritten in English and Hindi
  • Prem Behari Narain Raizada did the calligraphy
  • Artwork by Nandalal Bose and his students
Jan 26, 1950
Constitution Came Into Force

India became a Republic with Dr. Rajendra Prasad as first President.

Why January 26?

  • Commemorates the 1930 "Purna Swaraj" declaration
  • Original Constitution had 395 Articles and 8 Schedules
  • Currently has 470 Articles and 12 Schedules
  • Has been amended 105 times (as of 2023)
